com.github.maxstupo.flatengine.screen

Class AbstractScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.maxstupo.flatengine.screen.AbstractScreen

  • public abstract class AbstractScreen
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a game screen (e.g. main-menu, options menu, in-game, etc).

    Each screen contains a root GUI node allowing for a GUIs to be created for each game screen.

    Note: When overriding methods that do not start with the prefix 'on' (e.g. onActivated()) make sure to call the super method, as failing to do so may result in a GUI that doesn't work correctly.

    Author:
    Maxstupo

        protected abstract void update(float delta)
        All logic code for this screen goes within this method.

      • doUpdate

        protected void doUpdate(float delta)
        This method calls update(float) and also updates the GUI. It's called by the ScreenManager that owns this screen.

        Note: Don't override this unless you know what you are doing.

        Parameters:
        delta - the delta time.

      • doRender

        protected void doRender(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        This method calls render(Graphics2D) and also renders the GUI. It's called by the ScreenManager that owns this screen.

        Note: Don't override this method unless you know what you are doing.

        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context to draw to.

      • notifyResize

        protected void notifyResize(int width,
                            int height)
        This method calls onResize(int, int) and also notifies the GUI. It's called by the ScreenManager that owns this screen.
        Parameters:
        width - the new width of the window.
        height - the new height of the window.

      • notifyDeactivated

        protected void notifyDeactivated()
        This method calls onDeactivated() and also disposes the GUI. It's called by the ScreenManager that owns this screen.

        Note: Don't override or call this method unless you know what you are doing.

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Returns the id of the current screen in the screen manager. Because the screen manager can only have one screen instantiated at a time, the id will be the id of this screen object.
        Returns:
        the id of this screen.
